architectural_phases: Phase 0 – Identity-Stable Staging: lock execution to AGENT_HASH, refresh recursion audit, and confirm ARP baseline outputs remain read-only prior to SCP planning.
Phase 1 – Cognitive Foundations: map ARP reasoning surfaces to SCP Phase 1 subsystems (MVS, BDN, Trinity vectors) without invoking runtime initialisation.
Phase 2 – Modal Nexus Alignment: design the data pathways for SCP modal chains and nexus communication, ensuring ARP provides deterministic inputs and all side-effectful calls stay disabled.
Phase 3 – Enhancement Gating: specify the conditions under which SCP enhancement engines (learning, adaptation, self-improvement cycles) may be toggled on, including sandbox logging hooks.
Phase 4 – Cross-Protocol Validation: define integration tests that pair ARP cognitive bridges with SCP resource sharing while maintaining recursion audits and Coq proof checks as release gates.
safety_constraints: Read-only inspection of ARP and SCP codebases; no automatic execution of scp_operations.py or related binaries.
All planning artifacts must embed agent_hash and pass through boot_from_verified_identity() recursion audits after each change.
Human operator must approve any transition from planning to runtime activation and confirm sandbox boundaries are enforced.
Integration checkpoints require verification that Phase 1 Coq proofs remain unchanged and alignment log stays ALIGNED.
SCP enhancement features cannot be enabled unless ARP outputs are cached and replayed for deterministic testing inside the sandbox.
required_human_approvals: Alignment operator sign-off that the plan remains within constructive proof guarantees.
Safety lead approval for any change that alters sandbox read/write permissions.
Infrastructure owner approval before provisioning resources for SCP runtime experiments.
